main.docTitle: Appeal Board on Closure Orders (Immediate Health Hazard) Rules

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Appeal Board (上訴委員會) has the meaning specified in section 128A(2) of the Ordinance;
notice of appeal (上訴通知書) means the notice of appeal referred to in section 3;

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作天) means any day other than— (L.N. 44 of 2003)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public holiday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day as defined in section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s3
section.heading: How appeal is to be commenced
section.leadIn: A person exercising a right of appeal under section 128C(7) or (18) of the Ordinance shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: commence the appeal by serving on the Chairman a notice of appeal in Form 1 in the Schedule setting out the grounds of appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach to the notice of appeal copies of all documents, if any, on which he intends to rely in support of his appeal.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Service of notice of appeal
section.leadIn: The secretary shall, within one working day after a notice of appeal is served under section 3, serve a copy of it and copies of any documents attached to it on— (L.N. 44 of 2003)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person (other than the appellant) who is affected by the Authority’s decision or order which is the subject matter of the appeal. (L.N. 44 of 2003)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Authority to serve statement and relevant documents
section.leadIn: The Authority shall, within 3 working days after receiving a copy of the notice of appeal served under section 4, serve on the secretary and the appellant— (L.N. 44 of 2003)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: sets out the decision or order which is the subject matter of the appeal and the reasons for the decision or order;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sets out its findings on material questions of fact;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: refers to the evidence or other material on which those findings were based;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: identifies all persons who have made representations to the Authority within one month before the making of the decision or order which is the subject matter of the appeal regarding the matter in respect of which the decision or order was made; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: states the policy, if any, based on which the Authority made the decision or order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: copies of all documents, if any, which are in the possession or under the control of the Authority and are considered by the Authority to be relevant to the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: The appellant may, at least 3 working days before the date fixed for the hearing of an appeal under section 7 serve on— (L.N. 44 of 2003)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the secretary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority and any other person referred to in section 4(b),

subsection.continued: any further document, representation or material which is relevant to the appeal.

subsection.content: The person who is to preside at the hearing of an appeal may by order require the appellant, the Authority or any other person referred to in section 4(b) to produce any document or material in their respective possession or under their respective control and which is considered by the person who is to preside at the hearing to be relevant to the appeal.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Date, time and place of hearing

subsection.leadIn: The secretary shall, within 3 working days after a notice of appeal is served under section 3— (L.N. 44 of 2003)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fix the date, time and place for hearing an appeal in consultation with the person who is to preside at the hearing of the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve on the appellant and the Authority a notice of the date, time and place for hearing in Form 2 in the Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: The secretary shall, so far as reasonably practicable, fix the hearing date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a date which is within 10 working days after the receipt of the notice of appeal served under section 3; or (L.N. 44 of 2003)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on such date as the Chairman may deem fit.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Making representations at hearing
section.leadIn: The person who is to preside at the hearing of an appeal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the written request of either party to the appeal made at least 3 working days before the date fixed for the hearing of the appeal under section 7, invite any person who may be affected by the decision of the Appeal Board; or (L.N. 44 of 2003)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on its own motion, invite any person identified under section 5(a)(iv),

section.continued: by serving on that person a notice in writing, to make representations at the hearing of the appeal.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Hearing to be in public except in special circumstances

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the hearing of an appeal shall be in public.

subsection.leadIn: The Appeal Board may by order direct that the whole or part of the hearing of an appeal shall take place in private where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the parties to the appeal have mutually agreed to waive the right to public hearing as provided by article 10 of the Bill of Rights; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any party to the appeal applies on any of the grounds provided in article 10 of the Bill of Rights to hear the whole or part of the hearing in private and the Appeal Board considers it appropriate to do so.

subsection.def: In this section, Bill of Rights (人權法案) means the Hong Kong Bill of Rights set out in Part II of the Hong Kong Bill of Rights Ordinance (Cap. 383).

subsection.content: The hearing of an appeal may be conducted in Chinese or English or both as the person who is to preside at the hearing of the appeal thinks fit.
Notwithstanding subsection (1), a party to an appeal, his authorized representative or any person invited to make representations under section 8, may address the Appeal Board in any language.
An appellant may apply to the person who is to preside at the hearing of the appeal to conduct the hearing in Chinese or English or both. (L.N. 44 of 2003)
The appellant may, at any time before the hearing of an appeal, abandon the appeal or any grounds of the appeal by notice in writing served on the secretary.
An appellant who serves a notice under subsection (1) shall at the same time serve a copy of the notice on the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: If either party to an appeal fails to attend the hearing of the appeal in person or by his authorized representative on the date, time and place fixed, the Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is satisfied that his failure to appear is due to reasonable cause, adjourn the hearing to a date, time and place as it thinks fit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceed to hear the appeal in the absence of either party to the appeal and make a decision under section 128D(13)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: Where the date, time and place fixed for the hearing is adjourned under subsection (1)(a), the secretary shall, within one working day after the adjournment, serve on the appellant and the Authority a notice of the date, time and place for hearing in Form 3 in the Schedule. (L.N. 44 of 2003)
The Appeal Board shall, as soon as practicable and in any event not later than 10 working days after the completion of the hearing of an appeal, deliver its decision on the appeal. (L.N. 44 of 2003)
The Appeal Board may order its decision on an appeal to come into operation immediately or on a specified date. (L.N. 44 of 2003)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Mode of service
section.leadIn: Any document, notice, order, material or thing required to be served on any person under these Rules shall be effected—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the Chairman—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivery to him by hand ; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it at the office of the secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the secretary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivery to him by hand; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it at or by sending it through registered post to, the office of the secretary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivery to him by hand; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it at or by sending it through registered post to, the office of the Authority;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an appellant which is a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivery to the chairman, president, clerk, secretary, treasurer or similar officer of the appellant by hand; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it at or by sending it through registered post to, its address for service of documents stated in the notice of appeal served or the last known address of the appellant;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an appellant which is not a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivery to him by hand; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it at or by sending it through registered post to, his address for service of documents stated in the notice of appeal served or his last known address;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any other person which is a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivery to the chairman, president, clerk, secretary, treasurer or similar officer of the person by hand; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it at or by sending it through registered post to, its registered office in Hong Kong or any place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business or the last known address of the body corporate; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any other person who is not a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivery to him by hand; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by leaving it at or by sending it through registered post to, the last known address of the person.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Discretionary powers in the conduct of the appeal

subsection.leadIn: The Chairman may, on such terms as he thinks fit, after the commencement of an appeal under section 3—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: extend or abridge the period within which either party to the appeal is required or authorized by these Rules to do any act in any proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dispense with the requirement of service by either party to the appeal of any document, notice, order, material or thing under these Rules;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: change the date, time and place fixed for hearing of an appeal under section 7 in consultation with the person who is to preside at the hearing of the appeal.

subsection.content: The person who is to preside at the hearing of an appeal may exercise the powers conferred on the Chairman under subsection (1).

Where the date, time and place fixed for hearing of an appeal is changed under subsection (1)(c), the secretary shall, within one working day after the change, serve on the appellant and the Authority a notice of the date, time and place for hearing in Form 3 in the Schedule. (L.N. 44 of 2003)
